Description: Fragment of rim and bowl of East Greek pottery standed 'fruit-bowl'. Worn, with spalling. Clay brown with numerous lime particles and a few gold mica specks; creamy slip on upper surface. Paint black to sepia; purplish red and white additions. On rim, key maeander frieze; on bowl, from outside: band with added white-red-white lines; lotus and bud chain in silhouette (red on lotus centres); band with added white-red-white lines; bud motifs radiating from centre (ends of two preserved), with small cross motifs in field. Outside of rim glazed; underside plain, with three bands near edge and one (worn) further in.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hayes (1992, 205, N9): "For decorative scheme cf. the dish Fairbanks, Boston Cat. No. 324.7 pl. 35 (also no. 323.6); Alexandrescu, Histria IV 47-48, nos. 104, 106, pl.10 = Dupont (1983) 33 (listed under "North Ionian 2" ware); Venit, Naukratis no. 91 pp.26, 159, pl. 25 (also no.100 pl.27?). Other counterparts in the Klazomenai/ Teos series: Tocra I no. 615ff, pl. 34 (there designated Rhodian). The lime content is higher than usual (see N10 for standard fabric)."
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 205 no N9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.862)
